briefTitle: AGN-229666 Ophthalmic Solution for the Treatment of Seasonal or Perennial Allergic Conjunctivitis

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Japanese patients living in Japan with allergic conjunctivitis with itching and redness
* Able and willing to discontinue wearing any contact lenses during the study period.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Eye surgical intervention and/or a history of refractive surgery within 6 months
* History of retinal detachment, diabetic retinopathy, or progressive retinal disease
* Presence of active eye infection (bacterial, viral, or fungal)
* History of an eye herpetic infection
* Use of corticosteroids within 6 months or anticipated use during the study.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline In Ocular Itching Frequency Score Using a 6-point Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Ocular itching frequency is assessed on a 6-poing scale, where 0 = did not occur, 1 = once in 3 days, 2 = twice in 3 days, 3 = once every day, 4 = 2 or more times every day, and 5 = virtually all the time over the past 3 days. Ocular itching frequency is evaluated over the 3 days prior to the visit. A negative number change from baseline indicates an improvement and a positive number change from baseline indicates a worsening.
